Measures of profitability and costs, by: Explanation
Unnamed: 2: Why?

Measures of profitability and costs, by: Number of firms in the industry grouping.
Unnamed: 2: Law of large numbers?

Measures of profitability and costs, by: Aggregated gross profits as a percent of aggregated revenues, across companies in the group.
Unnamed: 2: Profitability after subtracting out the direct cost of production, but before fixed costs, financial expenses and taxes.

Measures of profitability and costs, by: Aggregated net profits as a percent of aggregated revenues, across companies in the group.
Unnamed: 2: Profitability, after all expenses and taxes, accrusing to stocholders in the firm

Measures of profitability and costs, by: Aggregated operating profits, prior to taxes and stock compensation, as a percent of aggregated revenues, across companies in the group.
Unnamed: 2: Operating profitablity, prior to taxes and expenses associated with stock based compensation

Measures of profitability and costs, by: Aggregated as-stated operating profits, prior to taxes, as a percent of aggregated revenues, across companies in the group.
Unnamed: 2: Operating profitability, as measured in financial statements.

Measures of profitability and costs, by: Aggregated as-stated operating profits, after netting effective taxes, as a percent of aggregated revenues, across companies in the group.
Unnamed: 2: Operating profitability, after assuming taxes paid at effective tax rate, as measured in financial statements.

Measures of profitability and costs, by: Aggregated operating profits, adjusted for leases treated as debt, as a percent of aggregated revenues, across companies in the group.
Unnamed: 2: Operating profitability, with leases treated as debt, prior to taxes.

Measures of profitability and costs, by: Aggregated operating profits, adjusted for leases treated as debt and taxes, as a percent of aggregated revenues, across companies in the group.
Unnamed: 2: Operating profitability, with leases treated as debt, after paying taxes (at effective tax rate)

Measures of profitability and costs, by: Aggregated operating profits, adjusted for leases treated as debt and R&D as a capital expense, as a percent of aggregated revenues, across companies in the group.
Unnamed: 2: Operating profitability, with leases treated as debt and capitalized R&D, prior to taxes.

Measures of profitability and costs, by: Aggregated operating profits, adjusted for leases treated as debt and R&D as a capital expense, after effective taxes, as a percent of aggregated revenues, across companies in the group.
Unnamed: 2: Operating profitability, with leases treated as debt and capitalized R&D, after paying taxes (at effective tax rate)

Measures of profitability and costs, by: Aggregated EBITDA as a percent of aggregated revenues, across companies in the group.
Unnamed: 2: Measure of pre-tax cash profitability of operations

Measures of profitability and costs, by: Aggregated EBITDA, with SG&A added back, as a percent of aggregated revenues, across companies in the group.
Unnamed: 2: Measure of pre-tax cash profitability, prior to SG&A expenses, of operations

Measures of profitability and costs, by: Aggregated cost of goods sold (COGS) as a percent of aggregated revenues, across companies in the group.
Unnamed: 2: Measure of direct costs of production, as percetn of sales, of products/services sold.

Measures of profitability and costs, by: Aggregated R&D costs as a percent of aggregated revenues, across companies in the group.
Unnamed: 2: Measure of investment in long term growth by companies that derive their value from the products of R&D (including patents and licenses).

Measures of profitability and costs, by: Aggregated SG&A costs as a percent of aggregated revenues, across companies in the group.
Unnamed: 2: Measure of SG&A costs as percent of sales.

Measures of profitability and costs, by: Aggregated stock-based compensation expensed,  as a percent of aggregated revenues, across companies in the group.
Unnamed: 2: Measure of expenses from stock-based compensation.

Measures of profitability and costs, by: Aggregated current year's lease expense, as a percent of aggregated revenues, across companies in the group.
Unnamed: 2: Measure of current year's lease expense, as percent of sales.

Measures of profitability and costs, by: Operating Income + Current year's lease exp - Lease Asset Depreciation
Unnamed: 2: Lease expenses are financing, not operating expenses. Hence we add them back. Treating leases as debt creates a lease asset, that needs to be depreciated. Hence the subtracting out of lease depreciation.

Measures of profitability and costs, by: Operating Income + Current year's R&D exp - Amortization of R&D asset
Unnamed: 2: R&D is a capital, not an operating expense. Hence we add it back. Treating R&D as a capital asset creates amortization over multiple perods. Hence we net out this amortization.
